FuncDef:
The qos cos burst-size command configures the burst size of a module.
The undo qos cos burst-size command restores the default configuration.
By default, the burst size of a module is not configured.
CLIs: qos cos { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 } burst-size <buffer-size-value>
undo qos cos { be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 } burst-size <buffer-size-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Set the service type to BE.
-

Set the service type to AF1.
-

Set the service type to AF2.
-

Set the service type to AF3.
-

Set the service type to AF4.
-

Set the service type to EF.
-

Set the service type to CS6.
-

Set the service type to CS7.
-

Specify the burst size of an eTM module. A larger burst size indicates a shorter latency and a higher burst traffic volume.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 64, in KB. The default value is 5 KB.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To adjust the relationships between the latency and burst traffic volume, run the qos cos burst-size command to configure the burst size of an eTM module. A larger burst size indicates a shorter latency and a higher burst traffic volume.
